1.title: The Game After the Whistle
1.plot: As the whistle blows, marking another Galaxy win over Real Salt Lake, we lock in on star defender Omar Gonzalez. We follow Omar learning what his life, training, diet and mental prep look like in between the whistles.

2.title: Staying Power
2.plot: Midfielder Marcelo Sarvas' tenacious ability to be everywhere he needs to be as a midfielder for a full 90 minute match is really sets him apart. We will break down one game's play and the impressive amount of energy exerted.

3.title: The Finishing Touch
3.plot: Everything on the pitch points towards that finishing touch that puts the ball in the back of the net. In this episode we will explore that touch through 21 year old striker Gyasi Zardes. Gyasi and his coaches will let us into both the physical and hugely mental side of what it takes to finish.

4.title: The Long Play
4.plot: At 37 years old with 16 seasons of MLS & 2 World Cups under his belt Pablo Mastroeni is one of America's most seasoned players. Pablo will let us in on his philosophy of the sport and the mindset, fitness and nutrition that has supported him making this long and illustrious career possible.

5.title: Always Ready
5.plot: At age 16, Jack McBean, was the youngest player to have signed for the Galaxy club in its history. Coming up through the LA Galaxy Academy, Jack shows enormous potential, and he let us in on what he thinks it will take to be a featured player. The Galaxy coaching staff helps us understand what a young player like Jack needs to do to get that coveted starting spot.

6.title: The Academy
6.plot: The LA Galaxy Academy's primary objective is to identify and develop local players who can make an impact as professionals with the first team. With seven teams ranging from under 12's to under 18's the Academy trains these dedicated and talented kids to instill discipline, health, nutrition, character, and confidence both on-and-off the field. Putting on the Galaxy crest comes with an expectation of sacrifice, professionalism and greatness at any level and the future stars of the Galaxy wear it well. Former Galaxy Captain and Academy Director, Peter Vagenes, shares ...

7.title: A Keeper's World
7.plot: We dive into LA Galaxy's brand new keeper Jaime Penedo's world and examine his perspective on life between the bars. With his own coach and a vastly different practice regimen, training looks a lot different for Jaime than his teammates. Jaime will also let us in on the mental rigors & constant pressure of competing at this level in this position.

8.title: On the Road
8.plot: On a trip to Costa Rica for a Champions League game we see what it is like to travel with the LA Galaxy. An important game in a foreign place with a long travel schedule provides many challenges as the Galaxy look to advance past Costa Rica's Cartagines club on their way to the Champions Cup.

imdb.plot outline: The short-form documentary series features eight episodes that holistically explore what it takes to be a professional soccer player through the eyes of some of the Los Angeles Galaxy's biggest stars. Featuring Galaxy players including Omar Gonzalez, Marcelo Sarvas and Jaime Penedo, "Be A Pro" dives into the mental and physical commitments and sacrifices that are made in order to perform at the highest level. Episodes look at the game's most crucial elements, including the physical strain, endurance, recovery, mental acuity, and general fitness; and demonstrate how these are tackled through dedication, discipline and diligent nutrition.
